intro: Mibora verna var. desvauxii, commonly known as the mountain mibora, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant prefers cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude cloud forests. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with a velvety texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
